tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE fitness_feedback (
    feedback_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    member_id INT,
    class_id INT,
    feedback_text TEXT,
    rating INT
);

CREATE TABLE member_feedback (
    feedback_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    class_id UUID REFERENCES fitness_classes(class_id),
    member_id UUID NOT NULL,
    feedback_text TEXT,
    rating INT NOT NULL
);
CREATE TABLE feedback (feedback_id INT, member_id INT, class_id INT, rating INT, comments TEXT);
CREATE TABLE members (member_id INT, first_name TEXT, last_name TEXT, email TEXT, phone_number TEXT);
CREATE TABLE fitness_classes (class_id INT, class_name TEXT, instructor TEXT, schedule TEXT, max_capacity INT);

CREATE TABLE feedback (
    feedback_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    class_id UUID,
    member_id UUID,
    feedback_text TEXT,
    rating INT
);

CREATE TABLE classes (
    class_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    class_name TEXT,
    instructor_name TEXT,
    class_time TIMESTAMP,
    class_duration INTERVAL
);
CREATE TABLE FitnessClasses (class_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, class_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, instructor_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL);
CREATE TABLE Members (member_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, member_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, email VARCHAR(50) UNIQUE NOT NULL);
CREATE TABLE Feedback (feedback_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, class_id INT REFERENCES FitnessClasses(class_id), member_id INT REFERENCES Members(member_id), rating INT NOT NULL, comments TEXT);
CREATE TABLE Ratings (rating_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, class_id INT REFERENCES FitnessClasses(class_id), average_rating FLOAT, total_ratings INT);
CREATE TABLE Instructors (instructor_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, instructor_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, expertise VARCHAR(100));
